name: Babiri Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the\ndamage taken from one supereffective\nSteel-type attack.

name: Chilan Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the\ndamage taken from one Normal-type attack.

name: Liechi Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its Attack stat will increase when it’s in\na pinch.

name: Ganlon Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its Defense stat will increase when it’s in\na pinch.

name: Salac Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its Speed stat will increase when it’s in\na pinch.

name: Petaya Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its Sp. Atk stat will increase when it’s in\na pinch.

name: Apicot Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its Sp. Def stat will increase when it’s in\na pinch.

name: Lansat Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its critical-hit ratio will increase when it’s\nin a pinch.

name: Starf Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, one of its stats will sharply increase\nwhen it’s in a pinch.

name: Enigma Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, being hit by a supereffective attack will\nrestore its HP.

name: Micle Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, its accuracy will increase just once when\nit’s in a pinch.

name: Custap Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon\nholds one, it will be able to move first just once\nwhen it’s in a pinch.

name: Jaboca Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a physical\nattack hits the Pokémon holding it, the attacker will\nalso be hurt.

name: Rowap Berry
description: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a special\nattack hits the Pokémon holding it, the attacker will\nalso be hurt.

name: Bright Powder
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It casts a tricky\nglare that lowers the opposing\nPokémon’s accuracy.

name: White Herb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It will restore any\nlowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

name: Macho Brace
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stiff, heavy\nbrace helps Pokémon grow strong but cuts Speed\nin battle.

name: Exp. Share
description: Turning on this special device will allow all the\nPokémon on your team to receive Exp. Points\nfrom battles.

name: Quick Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This light, sharp\nclaw lets the bearer move first occasionally.

name: Soothe Bell
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The comforting\nchime of this bell calms the holder, making\nit friendly.

name: Mental Herb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder\nshakes off move-binding effects to move freely.\nIt can be used only once.

name: Choice Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious\nheadband boosts Attack but only allows the use of\none move.

name: King’s Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder\nsuccessfully inflicts damage, the target may\nalso flinch.

name: Silver Powder
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a shiny\nsilver powder that will boost the power of\nBug-type moves.

name: Amulet Coin
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles any\nprize money received if the holding Pokémon joins\na battle.

name: Cleanse Tag
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep\nwild Pokémon away if the holder is the head of\nthe party.

name: Soul Dew
description: A wondrous orb to be held by either Latios or\nLatias. It raises the power of Psychic- and\nDragon-type moves.

name: Deep Sea Tooth
description: An item to be held by Clamperl. This fang gleams a\nsharp silver and raises the holder’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: Deep Sea Scale
description: An item to be held by Clamperl. This scale shines\nwith a faint pink and raises the holder’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: Smoke Ball
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the\nholder to flee from any wild Pokémon encounter\nwithout fail.

name: Everstone
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A Pokémon\nholding this peculiar stone is prevented\nfrom evolving.

name: Focus Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder may\nendure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just\n1 HP.

name: Lucky Egg
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s an egg filled\nwith happiness that earns extra Exp. Points\nin battle.

name: Scope Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a lens for\nscoping out weak points. It boosts the holder’s\ncritical-hit ratio.

name: Metal Coat
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a special\nmetallic film that can boost the power of\nSteel-type moves.

name: Leftovers
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder’s HP\nis slowly but steadily restored throughout\nevery battle.

name: Dragon Scale
description: A very tough and inflexible scale. Dragon-type\nPokémon may be holding this item when caught.

name: Light Ball
description: An item to be held by Pikachu. It’s a puzzling orb\nthat boosts its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

name: Soft Sand
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a loose, silky\nsand that boosts the power of Ground-type moves.

name: Hard Stone
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a durable\nstone that boosts the power of Rock-type moves.

name: Miracle Seed
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a seed\nimbued with life force that boosts the power of\nGrass-type moves.

name: Black Glasses
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A pair of\nshady-looking glasses that boost the power of\nDark-type moves.

name: Black Belt
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This belt helps\nthe wearer to focus and boosts the power of\nFighting-type moves.

name: Magnet
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a powerful\nmagnet that boosts the power of\nElectric-type moves.

name: Mystic Water
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\nteardrop-shaped gem boosts the power of\nWater-type moves.

name: Sharp Beak
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a long, sharp\nbeak that boosts the power of Flying-type moves.

name: Poison Barb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This small,\npoisonous barb boosts the power of\nPoison-type moves.

name: Never-Melt Ice
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a heat-\nrepelling piece of ice that boosts the power of \nIce-type moves.

name: Spell Tag
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a sinister,\neerie tag that boosts the power of\nGhost-type moves.

name: Twisted Spoon
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This spoon is\nimbued with telekinetic power and boosts\nPsychic-type moves.

name: Charcoal
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a combustible\nfuel that boosts the power of Fire-type moves.

name: Dragon Fang
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This hard and\nsharp fang boosts the power of\nDragon-type moves.

name: Silk Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a sumptuous\nscarf that boosts the power of Normal-type moves.

name: Up-Grade
description: A transparent device somehow filled with all sorts\nof data. It was produced by Silph Co.

name: Shell Bell
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder\nregains a little HP every time it inflicts damage\non others.

name: Sea Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has\na curious aroma that boosts the power of\nWater-type moves.

name: Lax Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The beguiling\naroma of this incense may cause attacks to miss\nits holder.

name: Lucky Punch
description: An item to be held by Chansey. This pair of lucky\nboxing gloves will boost Chansey’s critical-hit ratio.

name: Metal Powder
description: An item to be held by Ditto. Extremely fine yet\nhard, this odd powder boosts the Defense stat.

name: Thick Club
description: An item to be held by Cubone or Marowak. It’s a\nhard bone of some sort that boosts the\nAttack stat.

name: Stick
description: An item to be held by Farfetch’d. This very long\nand stiff stalk of leek boosts its critical-hit ratio.

name: Red Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest,\nit raises the Cool aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Blue Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest,\nit raises the Beauty aspect of the Pokémon\nholding it.

name: Pink Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest,\nit raises the Cute aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

name: Green Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest,\nit raises the Clever aspect of the Pokémon\nholding it.

name: Yellow Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest,\nit raises the Tough aspect of the Pokémon\nholding it.

name: Wide Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a magnifying\nlens that slightly boosts the accuracy of moves.

name: Muscle Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This headband\nexudes strength, slightly boosting the power of\nphysical moves.

name: Wise Glasses
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This thick pair of\nglasses slightly boosts the power of special moves.

name: Expert Belt
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a well-worn\nbelt that slightly boosts the power of\nsupereffective moves.

name: Light Clay
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Protective moves\nlike Light Screen and Reflect will be\neffective longer.

name: Life Orb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the\npower of moves, but at the cost of some HP on\neach hit.

name: Power Herb
description: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It\nallows the holder to immediately use a move that\nnormally requires a turn to charge.

name: Toxic Orb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a bizarre orb\nthat will badly poison the holder during battle.

name: Flame Orb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a bizarre orb\nthat will afflict the holder with a burn during battle.

name: Quick Powder
description: An item to be held by Ditto. Extremely fine yet\nhard, this odd powder boosts the Speed stat.

name: Focus Sash
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder has\nfull HP, it will endure a potential KO attack with\n1 HP. The item then disappears.

name: Zoom Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder\nmoves after its target moves, its accuracy will\nbe boosted.

name: Metronome
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts moves\nused consecutively, but only until a different move\nis used.

name: Iron Ball
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It lowers Speed\nand allows Ground-type moves to hit Flying-type\nand levitating holders.

name: Lagging Tail
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is tremendously\nheavy and makes the holder move slower\nthan usual.

name: Destiny Knot
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder\nbecomes infatuated, the opposing Pokémon will\nbe, too.

name: Black Sludge
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It gradually\nrestores HP to Poison-type Pokémon. It damages\nany other type.

name: Icy Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the\nduration of the move Hail when used by\nthe holder.

name: Smooth Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the\nduration of the move Sandstorm when used by\nthe holder.

name: Heat Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the\nduration of the move Sunny Day when used by\nthe holder.

name: Damp Rock
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the\nduration of the move Rain Dance when used by\nthe holder.

name: Grip Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the\nduration of multi-turn attacks like Bind and Wrap.

name: Choice Scarf
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious\nscarf boosts Speed but only allows the use of\none move.

name: Sticky Barb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It damages the\nholder every turn and may latch on to Pokémon\nthat touch the holder.

name: Power Bracer
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It reduces Speed\nbut allows the holder’s Attack stat to grow more\nafter battling.

name: Power Belt
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It reduces Speed\nbut allows the holder’s Defense stat to grow more\nafter battling.

name: Power Lens
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It reduces Speed\nbut allows the holder’s Sp. Atk stat to grow more\nafter battling.

name: Power Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It reduces Speed\nbut allows the holder’s Sp. Def stat to grow more\nafter battling.

name: Power Anklet
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It reduces Speed\nbut allows the holder’s Speed stat to grow more\nafter battling.

name: Power Weight
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It reduces Speed\nbut allows the holder’s maximum HP to grow more\nafter battling.

name: Shed Shell
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This discarded\ncarapace enables the holder to switch out of battle\nwithout fail.

name: Big Root
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the\namount of HP the holder recovers from \nHP-stealing moves.

name: Choice Specs
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These curious\nglasses boost Sp. Atk but only allow the use of\none move.

name: Flame Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Fire-type moves.

name: Splash Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Water-type moves.

name: Zap Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Electric-type moves.

name: Meadow Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Grass-type moves.

name: Icicle Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Ice-type moves.

name: Fist Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Fighting-type moves.

name: Toxic Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Poison-type moves.

name: Earth Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Ground-type moves.

name: Sky Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Flying-type moves.

name: Mind Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Psychic-type moves.

name: Insect Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Bug-type moves.

name: Stone Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Rock-type moves.

name: Spooky Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Ghost-type moves.

name: Draco Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Dragon-type moves.

name: Dread Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Dark-type moves.

name: Iron Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Steel-type moves.

name: Odd Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\nexotic-smelling incense boosts the power of\nPsychic-type moves.

name: Rock Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\nexotic-smelling incense boosts the power of\nRock-type moves.

name: Full Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\nexotic-smelling incense makes the holder bloated\nand slow moving.

name: Wave Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has\na curious aroma that boosts the power of\nWater-type moves.

name: Rose Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This\nexotic-smelling incense boosts the power of\nGrass-type moves.

name: Luck Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles any\nprize money received if the holding Pokémon joins\na battle.

name: Pure Incense
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep\nwild Pokémon away if the holder is the head of\nthe party.

name: Protector
description: A protective item of some sort. It is extremely stiff\nand heavy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Electirizer
description: A box packed with a tremendous amount of electric\nenergy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Magmarizer
description: A box packed with a tremendous amount of magma\nenergy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Dubious Disc
description: A transparent device overflowing with dubious\ndata. Its producer is unknown.

name: Reaper Cloth
description: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual\nenergy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Razor Claw
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sharply\nhooked claw increases the holder’s\ncritical-hit ratio.

name: Razor Fang
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder\nsuccessfully inflicts damage, the target may\nalso flinch.

name: TM01
description: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk\nstats increase.

name: TM02
description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

name: TM03
description: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to\nattack the target. This attack does\nphysical damage.

name: TM04
description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its\nspirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

name: TM05
description: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is\ndragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against\na single Pokémon.

name: TM06
description: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.\nIts poison damage worsens every turn.

name: TM07
description: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns.\nIt damages all Pokémon except the Ice type.

name: TM08
description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,\nraising both its Attack and Defense stats.

name: TM09
description: The user drenches the target in a special\npoisonous liquid. This move’s power is doubled\nif the target is poisoned.

name: TM10
description: A unique attack that varies in type depending on\nthe Pokémon using it.

name: TM11
description: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering\nup Fire-type moves. This also weakens the power\nof Water-type moves.

name: TM12
description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to\nuse only attack moves for three turns.

name: TM13
description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of\nenergy. This may also leave the target frozen.

name: TM14
description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing\nPokémon. This may also leave the opposing\nPokémon frozen.

name: TM15
description: The target is attacked with a powerful beam.\nThe user can’t move on the next turn.

name: TM16
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce\ndamage from special attacks for five turns.

name: TM17
description: Enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of\nfailing rises if it is used in succession.

name: TM18
description: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five\nturns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers\nthe power of Fire-type moves.

name: TM19
description: The user lands and rests its body. It restores the\nuser’s HP by up to half of its max HP.

name: TM20
description: The user creates a protective field that prevents\nstatus conditions for five turns.

name: TM21
description: This full-power attack grows more powerful the\nless the user likes its Trainer.

name: TM22
description: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then\nblasts a bundled beam on the next turn.

name: TM23
description: The user throws a stone or similar projectile to\nattack an opponent. A flying Pokémon will fall to\nthe ground when it’s hit.

name: TM24
description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.\nThis may also leave the target with paralysis.

name: TM25
description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to\ninflict damage. This may also leave the target\nwith paralysis.

name: TM26
description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every\nPokémon around it.

name: TM27
description: This full-power attack grows more powerful the\nmore the user likes its Trainer.

name: TM28
description: The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is\nrestored by half the damage taken by the target.

name: TM29
description: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.\nThis may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TM30
description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.\nThis may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TM31
description: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also\nbreak barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.

name: TM32
description: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of\nitself to raise its evasiveness.

name: TM33
description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce\ndamage from physical attacks for five turns.

name: TM34
description: The user strikes everything around it by swamping\nthe area with a giant sludge wave. This may also\npoison those hit.

name: TM35
description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.\nThis may also leave the target with a burn.

name: TM36
description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may\nalso poison the target.

name: TM37
description: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all\ncombatants except the Rock, Ground, and\nSteel types. Raises the Sp. Def of Rock types.

name: TM38
description: The target is attacked with an intense blast of\nall-consuming fire. This may also leave the target\nwith a burn.

name: TM39
description: Boulders are hurled at the target.\nThis also lowers the target’s Speed\nstat by preventing its movement.

name: TM40
description: The user confounds the target with speed, then\nslashes. This attack never misses.

name: TM41
description: The user torments and enrages the target, making it\nincapable of using the same move twice in a row.

name: TM42
description: This attack move doubles its power if the user is\npoisoned or burned, or if it has paralysis.

name: TM43
description: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks. Then,\nbuilding up more power, the user raises its\nSpeed stat.

name: TM44
description: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully\nrestores the user’s HP and heals any\nstatus conditions.

name: TM45
description: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target\nbecomes infatuated and less likely to attack.

name: TM46
description: The user attacks and steals the target’s held item\nsimultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it\nalready holds an item.

name: TM47
description: The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs,\nwhich lowers the target’s Speed stat.

name: TM48
description: The user attacks the target with a song. Others\ncan join in the Round to increase the power of\nthe attack.

name: TM49
description: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice.\nIf this move is used every turn, its power\nis increased.

name: TM50
description: The user attacks the target at full power.\nThe attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s\nSp. Atk stat.

name: TM51
description: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also\nraise the user’s Defense stat.

name: TM52
description: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes\nits power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.

name: TM53
description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at\nthe target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.

name: TM54
description: A restrained attack that prevents the target from\nfainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.

name: TM55
description: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target.\nThis may also leave the target with a burn.

name: TM56
description: The user flings its held item at the target to attack.\nThis move’s power and effects depend on the item.

name: TM57
description: The user attacks with an electric charge. The user\nmay use any remaining electricity to raise its\nSp. Atk stat.

name: TM58
description: The user takes the target into the sky, then drops\nit during the next turn. The target cannot attack\nwhile in the sky.

name: TM59
description: The user swings its body around violently to inflict\ndamage on everything in its vicinity.

name: TM60
description: The user suppresses the target and makes its\nmove go last.

name: TM61
description: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white flame at\nthe target to inflict a burn.

name: TM62
description: The user nimbly strikes the target.\nIf the user is not holding an item, this attack\ninflicts massive damage.

name: TM63
description: This move prevents the target from using its held\nitem for five turns. Its Trainer is also prevented\nfrom using items on it.

name: TM64
description: The user attacks everything around it by causing a\ntremendous explosion. The user faints upon using\nthis move.

name: TM65
description: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from\nshadows. Critical hits land more easily.

name: TM66
description: The user stores power, then attacks. If the user\nmoves after the target, this attack’s power will\nbe doubled.

name: TM67
description: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn.\nThe attack never misses.

name: TM68
description: The user charges at the target using every bit of\nits power. The user can’t move on the next turn.

name: TM69
description: The user polishes its body to reduce drag.\nThis can sharply raise the Speed stat.

name: TM70
description: This move reduces damage from physical and\nspecial moves for five turns. This can be used only\nin a hailstorm.

name: TM71
description: The user stabs the target from below with\nsharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.

name: TM72
description: After making its attack, the user rushes back to\nswitch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

name: TM73
description: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that\nparalyzes the target.

name: TM74
description: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.\nThe slower the user compared to the target, the\ngreater the move’s power.

name: TM75
description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.\nThis sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.

name: TM76
description: The user soars and then strikes its target on the\nnext turn.

name: TM77
description: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat\nchange made by the target.

name: TM78
description: The user strikes everything around it by stomping\ndown on the ground. This lowers the Speed stat of\nthose hit.

name: TM79
description: The user blows its cold breath on the target.\nThis attack always results in a critical hit.

name: TM80
description: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing Pokémon\nto inflict damage. This may also make the opposing\nPokémon flinch.

name: TM81
description: The user slashes at the target by crossing its\nscythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.

name: TM82
description: The target is knocked away, and a different\nPokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends\na battle against a single Pokémon.

name: TM83
description: The target is infested and attacked for four to five\nturns. The target can’t flee during this time.

name: TM84
description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle or arm\nsteeped in poison. This may also poison the target.

name: TM85
description: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target.\nIt absorbs half the damage caused to heal its\nown HP.

name: TM86
description: The user snares the target with grass and trips it.\nThe heavier the target, the greater the\nmove’s power.

name: TM87
description: The user enrages and confuses the target.\nHowever, this also sharply raises the target’s\nAttack stat.

name: TM88
description: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of\nthe moves it knows.

name: TM89
description: After making its attack, the user rushes back to\nswitch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

name: TM90
description: The user makes a copy of itself using some of its\nHP. The copy serves as the user’s decoy.

name: TM91
description: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it\nall at once. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TM92
description: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower\nPokémon get to move first for five turns.

name: HM01
description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.\nThis can also be used to cut down thin trees.

name: HM02
description: The user soars and then strikes its target on the\nnext turn. This can also be used to fly to any\nfamiliar town.

name: HM03
description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping\nits surroundings with a giant wave.

name: HM04
description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at\nmaximum power. This can also be used to move\nheavy boulders.

name: HM05
description: The user charges at the target and may make it\nflinch. This can also be used to climb a waterfall.

name: HM06
description: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower\nthe target’s Defense stat. This move can also\nshatter rocks in the field.

name: Explorer Kit
description: A bag filled with convenient tools for exploring.\nIt provides access to the Underground in the\nSinnoh region.

name: Loot Sack
description: A sturdy, spacious bag that is used to carry any\ntreasures or loot obtained in the coal mine.

name: Rule Book
description: It lists the rules for holding battles.\nFor Link Battles, you may choose which set of rules\nyou wish to use.

name: Poké Radar
description: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding\nin the tall grass. Its battery is recharged as\nyou walk.

name: Point Card
description: A card that lists how many Battle Points you\nhave earned.

name: Journal
description: A notebook that keeps a day-to-day record of your\nadventure so far.

name: Seal Case
description: A case for storing Seals that can be applied to the\nexteriors of Poké Balls.

name: Fashion Case
description: A lovely case to store colorful Props for your\nPokémon to wear in a musical.

name: Seal Bag
description: A tiny bag that can hold 10 Seals for decorating\nPoké Balls.

name: Pal Pad
description: A convenient notepad that is used to register your\nFriends and friend codes and keep a record of\nyour gameplay.

name: Works Key
description: A large key for operating the doors of the\nValley Windworks in the canyon. It was held by\na Team Galactic Grunt.

name: Old Charm
description: An ancient good-luck charm made of Pokémon\nbones to be taken to the elder of Celestic Town.

name: Galactic Key
description: A card key for disengaging the security systems in\nthe Galactic HQ. Losing it can result in\npunishment, apparently.

name: Red Chain
description: A mythical chain that is said to link the\nLegendary Pokémon that created the Sinnoh region.

name: Town Map
description: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime.\nIt even shows you your present location in\nthe region.

name: Vs. Seeker
description: A device that indicates Trainers who want to\nbattle. Its battery charges while you walk.

name: Coin Case
description: A case for holding coins obtained at the\nGame Corner. It can hold up to 50,000 coins.

name: Old Rod
description: An old and beat-up fishing rod. Use it at any body\nof water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Good Rod
description: A new, good-quality fishing rod. Use it at any body\nof water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Super Rod
description: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod. Use it at any\nbody of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

name: Sprayduck
description: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck. It helps\npromote the healthy growth of any Berries planted\nin good, soft soil.

name: Poffin Case
description: A case for storing Poffins cooked from Berries.

name: Bike
description: A folding Bike that enables a rider to get around\nmuch faster than with Running Shoes.

name: Suite Key
description: A key to one of the suites at a certain luxury hotel\nby a lake. For some odd reason, it often disappears.

name: Oak’s Letter
description: A letter from Professor Oak. Written in it is a\nrequest for you to go to Route 224.

name: Lunar Wing
description: A feather that glows like the moon. It’s said to\npossess the power to dispel nightmares.

name: Member Card
description: A card needed for entering the inn in Canalave City.\nOddly, the last date marked on it was\n50 years ago.

name: Azure Flute
description: A flute that puts out echoing sounds that do not\nseem to be of this world. No one knows who\nmade it.

name: S.S. Ticket
description: A ticket required for sailing on the ferry S.S. Aqua.\nIt has a drawing of a ship on its front.

name: Contest Pass
description: A pass required for entering Pokémon Contests.\nIt has a drawing of an award ribbon on its front.

name: Magma Stone
description: A stone formed by boulders melting in intensely hot\nmagma, then hardening. Magma remains sealed\ninside it.

name: Parcel
description: A parcel entrusted into your care. You’re supposed\nto deliver it to your childhood friend who left\nTwinleaf Town.

name: Coupon 1
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch—\nPokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

name: Coupon 2
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch—\nPokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

name: Coupon 3
description: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch—\nPokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

name: Storage Key
description: The key to Team Galactic’s sinister warehouse\nlocated at the edge of Veilstone City.

name: Secret Potion
description: A fantastic medicine dispensed by the pharmacy in\nCianwood City. It fully heals a Pokémon of\nany ailment.

name: Vs. Recorder
description: An amazing device that can record a battle\nbetween friends or the battles at certain special\nbattle facilities.

name: Gracidea
description: A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets to convey\ngratitude on special occasions like birthdays.

name: Secret Key
description: A high-tech key that has to be used at a specific\nlocation. It emits a special electronic signal to open\na door.

name: Apricorn Box
description: A handy box where you can store up to 99 of each\nkind of Apricorn.

name: Unown Report
description: A report of all the discovered kinds of Unown.

name: Berry Pots
description: Handy containers for cultivating Berries wherever\nyou go.

name: Dowsing Machine
description: This high-tech machine shows the location of\ninvisible items. It’s attached to the head when\nin use.

name: Blue Card
description: A card to save points for the\nBuena’s Password show.

name: Slowpoke Tail
description: A very tasty tail of something. It can be sold at a\nhigh price to shops.

name: Clear Bell
description: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle\nringing sound.

name: Card Key
description: A card key that opens a shutter in the\nRadio Tower.

name: Basement Key
description: A key that opens a door in the\nGoldenrod Tunnel.

name: Squirt Bottle
description: A bottle used for watering plants in the Berry Pots.

name: Red Scale
description: A scale from a red Gyarados. It glows red like\na flame.

name: Lost Item
description: The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by the Copycat.

name: Pass
description: A pass required for riding the Magnet Train.\nIt allows you to ride whenever and however much\nyou’d like.

name: Machine Part
description: An important part of a machine that was stolen\nfrom the Power Plant.

name: Silver Wing
description: A strange, silvery feather that sparkles.

name: Rainbow Wing
description: A mystical rainbow feather that sparkles.

name: Mystery Egg
description: A mysterious Egg obtained from Mr. Pokémon.\nWhat is in the Egg is unknown.

name: Red Apricorn
description: A red Apricorn. It assails your nostrils.

name: Blue Apricorn
description: A blue Apricorn. It smells a bit like grass.

name: Yellow Apricorn
description: A yellow Apricorn. It has an invigorating scent.

name: Green Apricorn
description: A green Apricorn. It has a mysterious,\naromatic scent.

name: Pink Apricorn
description: A pink Apricorn. It has a nice, sweet scent.

name: White Apricorn
description: A white Apricorn. It doesn’t smell like anything.

name: Black Apricorn
description: A black Apricorn. It has a scent beyond\none’s experience.

name: Fast Ball
description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon\nthat are usually very quick to run away.

name: Level Ball
description: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon\nthat are at a lower level than your own Pokémon.

name: Lure Ball
description: A Poké Ball that is good for catching Pokémon that\nyou reel in with a rod while out fishing.

name: Heavy Ball
description: A Poké Ball that is better than usual at catching\nvery heavy Pokémon.

name: Love Ball
description: A Poké Ball that works best when catching a\nPokémon that is of the opposite gender of\nyour Pokémon.

name: Friend Ball
description: A strange Poké Ball that will make the wild\nPokémon caught with it more friendly toward\nyou immediately.

name: Moon Ball
description: A Poké Ball that will make it easier to catch\nPokémon that can evolve using a Moon Stone.

name: Sport Ball
description: A special Poké Ball that is used during the\nBug-Catching Contest.

name: Park Ball
description: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

name: Photo Album
description: A nice photo album for storing all the photos taken\nalong your adventure.

name: GB Sounds
description: A music player that allows you to listen to nostalgic\nsongs. It’s operated with the flip of a single switch.

name: Tidal Bell
description: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle\nringing sound.

name: Rage Candy Bar
description: Mahogany Town’s famous candy. It can be used\nonce to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Data Card 01
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many victories you have had in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 02
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many losses you have had in the Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 03
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon dashed in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 04
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon jumped in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 05
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nHurdle Dash.

name: Data Card 06
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nRelay Run.

name: Data Card 07
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nPennant Capture.

name: Data Card 08
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nBlock Smash.

name: Data Card 09
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nDisc Catch.

name: Data Card 10
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nSnow Throw.

name: Data Card 11
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many points your Pokémon scored in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 12
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon failed in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 13
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon\nimpeded themselves.

name: Data Card 14
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon tackled in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 15
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon fell down in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 16
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nRing Drop.

name: Data Card 17
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nLamp Jump.

name: Data Card 18
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nCircle Push.

name: Data Card 19
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many Link Pokéathlon wins you have had.

name: Data Card 20
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many Link Pokéathlon losses you have had.

name: Data Card 21
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you have won a Pokéathlon event.

name: Data Card 22
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you have lost a Pokéathlon event.

name: Data Card 23
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you switched Pokémon in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Data Card 24
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you won the Pokéathlon’s\nGoal Roll.

name: Data Card 25
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times your Pokémon won\nindividual prizes.

name: Data Card 26
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow many times you instructed your Pokémon.

name: Data Card 27
description: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows\nhow much time you spent participating in\nthe Pokéathlon.

name: Jade Orb
description: A shiny green orb that is said to have a legend tied\nto it. It’s known to have a deep connection with the\nHoenn region.

name: Lock Capsule
description: A sturdy Capsule that can only be opened with a\nspecial key.

name: Red Orb
description: A shiny red orb that is said to have a legend tied\nto it. It’s known to have a deep connection with the\nHoenn region.

name: Blue Orb
description: A shiny blue orb that is said to have a legend tied\nto it. It’s known to have a deep connection with the\nHoenn region.

name: Enigma Stone
description: A crystal ball that was excavated from the ground.\nIt’s a very beautiful stone that is covered with bits\nof rock and earth.

name: Prism Scale
description: A mysterious scale that causes a certain Pokémon\nto evolve. It shines in rainbow colors.

name: Eviolite
description: A mysterious Evolutionary lump. When held by a\nPokémon that can still evolve, it raises both\nDefense and Sp. Def.

name: Float Stone
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This very light\nstone reduces the weight of a Pokémon when held.

name: Rocky Helmet
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is\nhit, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

name: Air Balloon
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder will\nfloat in the air until hit. Once hit, this item\nwill burst.

name: Red Card
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder\nis hit by an attack, the attacker is removed\nfrom battle.

name: Ring Target
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Moves that\nnormally have no effect will land on a Pokémon\nholding it.

name: Binding Band
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A band that\nincreases the power of binding moves used by\nthe holder.

name: Absorb Bulb
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Atk\nif hit with a Water-type attack. It can only be\nused once.

name: Cell Battery
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack\nif hit with an Electric-type attack. It can only be\nused once.

name: Eject Button
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is\nhit by an attack, it will be switched out of battle.

name: Fire Gem
description: A gem with an essence of fire. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Fire-type move\none time.

name: Water Gem
description: A gem with an essence of water. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Water-type move\none time.

name: Electric Gem
description: A gem with an essence of electricity. When held,\nit strengthens the power of an Electric-type move\none time.

name: Grass Gem
description: A gem with an essence of nature. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Grass-type move\none time.

name: Ice Gem
description: A gem with an essence of ice. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of an Ice-type move\none time.

name: Fighting Gem
description: A gem with an essence of combat. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Fighting-type move\none time.

name: Poison Gem
description: A gem with an essence of poison. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Poison-type move\none time.

name: Ground Gem
description: A gem with an essence of land. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Ground-type move\none time.

name: Flying Gem
description: A gem with an essence of air. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Flying-type move\none time.

name: Psychic Gem
description: A gem with an essence of the mind. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Psychic-type move\none time.

name: Bug Gem
description: A gem with an insect-like essence. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Bug-type move\none time.

name: Rock Gem
description: A gem with an essence of rock. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Rock-type move\none time.

name: Ghost Gem
description: A gem with a spectral essence. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Ghost-type move\none time.

name: Dragon Gem
description: A gem with a draconic essence. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Dragon-type move\none time.

name: Dark Gem
description: A gem with an essence of darkness. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Dark-type move\none time.

name: Steel Gem
description: A gem with an essence of steel. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Steel-type move\none time.

name: Normal Gem
description: A gem with an ordinary essence. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Normal-type move\none time.

name: Health Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases\nthe base HP of a single Pokémon.

name: Muscle Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases\nthe base Attack stat of a single Pokémon.

name: Resist Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases\nthe base Defense stat of a single Pokémon.

name: Genius Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases\nthe base Sp. Atk stat of a single Pokémon.

name: Clever Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases\nthe base Sp. Def stat of a single Pokémon.

name: Swift Wing
description: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases\nthe base Speed stat of a single Pokémon.

name: Pretty Wing
description: Though this feather is beautiful, it’s just a regular\nfeather and has no effect on Pokémon.

name: Cover Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived\nin the sea. It appears as though it could be part of\nits back.

name: Plume Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived\nin the sky. It looks as if it could come from part of\nits wing.

name: Liberty Pass
description: A special pass to go to Liberty Garden.\nBoard the ship in Castelia City.

name: Pass Orb
description: A mysterious orb containing the power of the\nUnova region, to be used when generating\nPass Power.

name: Dream Ball
description: A special Poké Ball that appears in your Bag out of\nnowhere in the Entree Forest. It can catch\nany Pokémon.

name: Poké Toy
description: A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokémon.\nIt guarantees escape from any battle with\nwild Pokémon.

name: Prop Case
description: A lovely case to store colorful Props for your\nPokémon to wear in a musical.

name: Dragon Skull
description: A skull of a Pokémon that was said to have braved\nthe angry waters to fly around the world.

name: Balm Mushroom
description: A rare mushroom that gives off a nice fragrance.\nIt can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Big Nugget
description: A big nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous\ngleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Pearl String
description: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver\ncolor. They can be sold at a high price to shops.

name: Comet Shard
description: A shard that fell to the ground when a comet\napproached. It can be sold at a high price\nto shops.

name: Relic Copper
description: A copper coin used by an ancient civilization about\n3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Silver
description: A silver coin used by an ancient civilization about\n3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Gold
description: A gold coin used by an ancient civilization about\n3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Vase
description: A fragile vase made by an ancient civilization about\n3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Band
description: A heavy bracelet made by an ancient civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Statue
description: A stone figurine made by an ancient civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.

name: Relic Crown
description: A heavy crown made by an ancient civilization\nabout 3,000 years ago.

name: Casteliacone
description: Castelia City’s specialty, soft-serve ice cream.\nIt can be used once to heal all the status conditions\nof a Pokémon.

name: Dire Hit 2
description: It can be used many times to raise the critical-hit\nratio of one Pokémon. It wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.

name: X Speed 2
description: It sharply raises the Speed stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Atk 2
description: It sharply raises the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Def 2
description: It sharply raises the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

description: It sharply raises the Defense stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Attack 2
description: It sharply raises the Attack stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Accuracy 2
description: It sharply raises the accuracy of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Speed 3
description: It drastically raises the Speed stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Atk 3
description: It drastically raises the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon\nin battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Def 3
description: It drastically raises the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon\nin battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Defense 3
description: It drastically raises the Defense stat of a Pokémon\nin battle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Attack 3
description: It drastically raises the Attack stat of a Pokémon in\nbattle. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

name: X Accuracy 3

name: X Speed 6
description: It raises the Speed stat of a Pokémon in battle\nimmensely. It wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Atk 6
description: It raises the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon in battle\nimmensely. It wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.

name: X Sp. Def 6
description: It raises the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon in battle\nimmensely. It wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.

description: It raises the Attack stat of a Pokémon in battle\nimmensely. It wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.

name: X Accuracy 6
description: It raises the accuracy of a Pokémon in battle\nimmensely. It wears off if the Pokémon\nis withdrawn.

name: Ability Urge
description: When used, it activates the Ability of an\nally Pokémon.

name: Item Drop
description: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to drop a\nheld item.

name: Item Urge
description: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to use its\nheld item.

name: Reset Urge
description: When used, it restores any stat changes of an\nally Pokémon.

name: Dire Hit 3
description: It can be used many times to greatly raise a\nPokémon’s critical-hit ratio. It wears off if the\nPokémon is withdrawn.

name: Light Stone
description: Reshiram’s body was destroyed and changed into\nthis stone. It is said to be waiting for the\nemergence of a hero.

name: Dark Stone
description: Zekrom’s body was destroyed and changed into\nthis stone. It is said to be waiting for the\nemergence of a hero.

name: TM93
description: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes\ninto its target. This also damages the user a little.

name: TM94
description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping\nits surroundings with a giant wave.

name: TM95
description: The user yells as if it’s ranting about something,\nwhich lowers the Sp. Atk stat of\nopposing Pokémon.

name: Xtransceiver
description: A high-tech transceiver with a camera function.\nIt allows up to four-way calls.

name: Gram 1
description: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

name: Gram 2
description: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

name: Gram 3
description: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

name: Xtransceiver
description: A high-tech transceiver with a camera function.\nIt allows up to four-way calls.

name: Medal Box
description: A box-shaped machine that stores Medals and\nMedal information.

name: DNA Splicers
description: A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a certain Pokémon.\nThey are said to have been one in the beginning.

name: DNA Splicers
description: A splicer that separates Kyurem and a certain\nPokémon when they have been fused.

name: Permit
description: A permit that is needed to enter the\nNature Preserve. Not many know about it.

name: Oval Charm
description: An oval charm said to increase the chance of\nPokémon Eggs being found at the Nursery.

name: Shiny Charm
description: A shiny charm said to increase the chance of\nfinding a Shiny Pokémon in the wild.

name: Plasma Card
description: A card key needed to enter the password inside\nthe Plasma Frigate.

name: Grubby Hanky
description: A handkerchief dropped by a regular at\nCafé Warehouse. It smells faintly like a Pokémon.

name: Colress Machine
description: A special device that wrings out the potential of\nPokémon. It’s an imperfect prototype.

name: Dropped Item
description: The Xtransceiver found at the Nimbasa City\namusement park. It seems it belongs to a boy.

name: Dropped Item
description: The Xtransceiver found at the Nimbasa City\namusement park. It seems it belongs to a girl.

name: Reveal Glass
description: A looking glass that reveals the truth. It’s a\nmysterious glass that returns a Pokémon to its\noriginal shape.

name: Weakness Policy
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Attack and\nSp. Atk sharply increase if the holder is hit with\na move it’s weak to.

name: Assault Vest
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This offensive\nvest raises Sp. Def but prevents the use of\nstatus moves.

name: Holo Caster
description: A device that allows users to receive and view\nhologram clips at any time. It’s also used to chat\nwith others.

name: Prof’s Letter
description: A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote to your\nmother. A faint but pleasant perfume seems to\ncling to the paper.

name: Roller Skates
description: Attaches roller skates to the bottom of your shoes,\nallowing you to glide quickly around and\nperform tricks.

name: Pixie Plate
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet\nthat boosts the power of Fairy-type moves.

name: Ability Capsule
description: A capsule that allows a Pokémon with two Abilities\nto switch between these Abilities when it is used.

name: Whipped Dream
description: A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy, puffy,\nwhipped, and whirled cream. It’s loved by a\ncertain Pokémon.

name: Sachet
description: A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes that are just\nslightly too overwhelming. Yet it’s loved by a\ncertain Pokémon.

name: Luminous Moss
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def\nif hit with a Water-type attack. It can only be\nused once.

name: Snowball
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack\nif hit with an Ice-type attack. It can only be\nused once.

name: Safety Goggles
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These goggles\nprotect the holder from both weather-related\ndamage and powder.

name: Poké Flute
description: A flute that can play with such a beautiful tone\nthat even sleeping Pokémon find\nthemselves roused.

name: Rich Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears\nto be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and\nhas no effect.

name: Surprise Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears\nto be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and\nhas no effect.

name: Boost Mulch

name: Amaze Mulch
description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears\nto be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and\nhas no effect.

name: Roseli Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will lessen the\ndamage taken from one supereffective\nFairy-type attack.

name: Kee Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the\nholder’s Defense if it’s hit with a physical move.

name: Maranga Berry
description: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the\nholder’s Sp. Def if it’s hit with a special move.

name: Sprinklotad
description: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps\npromote the healthy growth of any Berries planted\nin good, soft soil.

name: TM96
description: This attack makes use of nature’s power. Its\neffects vary depending on the user’s environment.

name: TM97
description: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark\nthoughts. This may also make the target flinch.

name: TM98
description: The user charges at the target and may make\nit flinch.

name: TM99
description: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a\npowerful flash.

name: TM100
description: The user tells the target a secret, and the target\nloses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the\ntarget’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: Power Plant Pass
description: This pass serves as an ID card for gaining access\nto the power plant that lies along Route 13.

name: Mega Ring
description: This ring contains an untold power that somehow\nenables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to\nMega Evolve in battle.

name: Intriguing Stone
description: A rather curious stone that might appear valuable\nto some. It’s all in the eye of the beholder.

name: Common Stone
description: A perfectly normal stone that might appear to be\nvaluable to some. It’s all in the eye of the beholder.

name: Discount Coupon
description: This special coupon allows you to buy items at a\ndiscount when you are shopping at a boutique.

name: Elevator Key
description: A card key that activates the elevator in Lysandre\nLabs. It is emblazoned with Team Flare’s logo.

name: TMV Pass
description: A commuter pass that allows the holder to ride the\nTMV between Lumiose City and Kiloude City at\nany time.

name: Honor of Kalos
description: A precious symbol that is awarded only to an\nindividual who has done great things for the\nKalos region.

name: Adventure Rules
description: This book contains all the points a new Trainer\nneeds to know on a journey. It was handmade by\na kind friend.

name: Strange Souvenir
description: An ornament depicting a mysterious Pokémon\nthat has been venerated as a guardian deity\nfor an extremely long time in the Alola region.

name: Lens Case
description: A rather chic-looking case for carrying\ncontact lenses.

name: Makeup Bag
description: A rather chic-looking case for carrying lipsticks.

name: Travel Trunk
description: A light and yet incredibly effective trunk, which can\ncontain every last piece of clothing that can\nbe bought.

name: Lumiose Galette
description: A popular treat in Lumiose City. It can be used once\nto heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Shalour Sable
description: Shalour City’s famous shortbread. It can be used\nonce to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

name: Jaw Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived\non the land. It looks as if it could be a piece of a\nlarge jaw.

name: Sail Fossil
description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived\non the land. It looks like the impression from a\nskin sail.

name: Looker Ticket
description: A ticket that was handmade by Looker. It’s\ndecorated with a liberal amount of glittery paint.

name: Bike
description: A folding Bike that enables a rider to get around\nmuch faster than with Running Shoes.

name: Holo Caster
description: A device that allows users to receive and view\nhologram clips at any time. It’s also used to chat\nwith others.

name: Fairy Gem
description: A gem with an essence of the fey. When held, it\nstrengthens the power of a Fairy-type move\none time.

name: Mega Charm
description: This charm contains an untold power that somehow\nenables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to\nMega Evolve in battle.

name: Mega Glove
description: This glove contains an untold power that somehow\nenables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to\nMega Evolve in battle.

name: Mach Bike
description: This folding Bike more than doubles your\nmovement speed.

name: Acro Bike
description: This folding Bike allows you to perform actions\nsuch as wheelies and bunny hops.

name: Wailmer Pail
description: This is a tool for watering Berries you planted to\nmake them grow more quickly.

name: Devon Parts
description: A case that contains mechanical parts of some sort\nmade by the Devon Corporation.

name: Soot Sack
description: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

name: Basement Key
description: The key to New Mauville, which was constructed\nbeneath Mauville City.

name: Pokéblock Kit
description: A set containing a Berry Blender for making\nPokéblocks and a Pokéblock Case for\nstoring Pokéblocks.

name: Letter
description: An extremely important letter to Steven from the\nPresident of Devon Corporation.

name: Eon Ticket
description: The ticket required for sailing on a ferry to the\nSouthern Island. Does Norman, the Petalburg Gym\nLeader, know a secret?!

name: Scanner
description: A device found inside Sea Mauville.

name: Go-Goggles
description: Nifty goggles to protect eyes from\ndesert sandstorms.

name: Meteorite
description: A Meteorite originally found at Meteor Falls.\nYou got it at Mt. Chimney.

name: Key to Room 1
description: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

name: Key to Room 2
description: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

name: Key to Room 4
description: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

name: Key to Room 6
description: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

name: Storage Key
description: A key that opens the storage hold inside\nSea Mauville.

name: Devon Scope
description: A special device made by Devon Corporation that\nsignals the presence of any unseen Pokémon.

name: S.S. Ticket
description: Ticket required for sailing on a ferry.

name: HM07
description: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and\nattacks on the next turn.

name: Devon Scuba Gear
description: A device made by Devon Corporation that provides\noxygen to users during the use of Dive.

name: Contest Costume
description: A very cool suit to be worn during the\nContest Spectacular.

name: Contest Costume
description: A very cute dress to be worn during the\nContest Spectacular.

name: Magma Suit
description: A suit made with the collective technological\nknow-how of Team Magma. It can withstand\nany impact.

name: Aqua Suit
description: A suit made with the collective technological\nknow-how of Team Aqua. It can withstand\nany impact.

name: Pair of Tickets
description: Tickets for two to the astronomical show being\nheld at the Mossdeep Space Center.

name: Mega Bracelet
description: This cuff contains an untold power that somehow\nenables Pokémon carrying a Mega Stone to\nMega Evolve in battle.

name: Meteorite
description: A Meteorite that you got at Mt. Chimney. It gives off\na faint glow.

name: Pidgeotite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Pidgeot hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Glalitite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Glalie hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Diancite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Diancie hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Prison Bottle
description: A bottle believed to have been used to seal away\nthe power of a certain Pokémon long, long ago.

name: Mega Cuff
description: This bracelet contains an untold power that\nsomehow enables Pokémon carrying a Mega Stone\nto Mega Evolve in battle.

name: Cameruptite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Camerupt hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Lopunnite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Lopunny hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Salamencite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Salamence hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Beedrillite
description: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones.\nHave Beedrill hold it, and this stone will enable it\nto Mega Evolve during battle.

name: Meteorite
description: A Meteorite that you got at Mt. Chimney.\nIt continues to give off a faint glow and is slightly\nwarm to the touch.

name: Meteorite
description: A Meteorite that you got at Mt. Chimney.\nSome sort of pattern has risen to the surface,\nand it’s shining with seven colors of light.

name: Key Stone
description: A stone filled with an unexplained power. It makes\nPokémon that battle with a Mega Stone\nMega Evolve.

name: Meteorite Shard
description: One of the fragments of a Meteorite from\nGranite Cave. It’s faintly warm to the touch.

name: Eon Flute
description: A flute that can be used to summon Latios or Latias\nno matter where you are.

name: Normalium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Normal-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Firium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Fire-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Waterium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Water-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Electrium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Electric-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Grassium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Grass-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Icium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Ice-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Fightinium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Fighting-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Poisonium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Poison-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Groundium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Ground-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Flyinium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Flying-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Psychium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Psychic-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Buginium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Bug-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Rockium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Rock-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Ghostium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Ghost-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Dragonium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Dragon-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Darkinium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Dark-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Steelium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Steel-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Fairium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Fairy-type moves to Z-Moves.

name: Pikanium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Pikachu’s Volt Tackle to a Z-Move.

name: Bottle Cap
description: A beautiful bottle cap that gives off a silver gleam.\nSome people are happy to receive one.

name: Gold Bottle Cap
description: A beautiful bottle cap that gives off a golden gleam.\nSome people are happy to receive one.

name: Z-Ring
description: A mysterious ring that enables Pokémon to use\nZ-Power. It requires both the willpower and\nthe physical power of the Trainer wearing it.

name: Decidium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Decidueye’s Spirit Shackle to a Z-Move.

name: Incinium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Incineroar’s Darkest Lariat to a Z-Move.

name: Primarium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Primarina’s Sparkling Aria to a Z-Move.

name: Tapunium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades\nthe tapu’s Nature’s Madness to a Z-Move.

name: Marshadium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Marshadow’s Spectral Thief to\na Z-Move.

name: Aloraichium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades\nAlolan Raichu’s Thunderbolt to a Z-Move.

name: Snorlium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Snorlax’s Giga Impact to a Z-Move.

name: Eevium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Eevee’s Last Resort to a Z-Move.

name: Mewnium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Mew’s Psychic to a Z-Move.

name: Normalium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nNormal-type moves to Normal-type Z-Moves.

name: Firium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nFire-type moves to Fire-type Z-Moves.

name: Waterium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nWater-type moves to Water-type Z-Moves.

description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nFighting-type moves to Fighting-type Z-Moves.

name: Rockium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nRock-type moves to Rock-type Z-Moves.

name: Ghostium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nGhost-type moves to Ghost-type Z-Moves.

name: Dragonium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nDragon-type moves to Dragon-type Z-Moves.

name: Darkinium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nDark-type moves to Dark-type Z-Moves.

name: Steelium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nSteel-type moves to Steel-type Z-Moves.

name: Fairium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nFairy-type moves to Fairy-type Z-Moves.

name: Pikanium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nPikachu’s Volt Tackle to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Decidium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nDecidueye’s Spirit Shackle to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Incinium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nIncineroar’s Darkest Lariat to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Primarium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nPrimarina’s Sparkling Aria to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Tapunium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade the\ntapu’s Nature’s Madness to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Marshadium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nMarshadow’s Spectral Thief to an\nexclusive Z-Move.

name: Aloraichium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nAlolan Raichu’s Thunderbolt to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Snorlium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nSnorlax’s Giga Impact to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Eevium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nEevee’s Last Resort to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Mewnium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\nMew’s Psychic to an exclusive Z-Move.

name: Pikashunium Z
description: It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade\na Thunderbolt by Pikachu in a cap to an\nexclusive Z-Move.

name: Pikashunium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades a Thunderbolt by Pikachu in a cap to\na Z-Move.

name: Forage Bag
description: A bag to carry ingredients gathered during Mallow’s\ntrial in the jungle.

name: Fishing Rod
description: A fishing rod made by Captain Lana. Cast a line\nover piles of underwater rocks to fish for wild\naquatic Pokémon.

name: Professor’s Mask
description: The mask that belongs to The Masked Royal. \nThis pro wrestler apparently sews his mask on a\nmachine himself.

name: Festival Ticket
description: A ticket that allows you to host a mission in\nFestival Plaza.

name: Sparkling Stone
description: A stone entrusted by a Pokémon that has been\nvenerated as a guardian deity in the Alola region.\nThere is said to be some secret in how it sparkles.

name: Adrenaline Orb
description: Using it makes wild Pokémon call for help a number\nof times. If held by a Pokémon, it boosts Speed\nwhen intimidated. It can be used only once.

name: Zygarde Cube
description: An item to store Zygarde Cores and Cells.\nYou can also use it to teach Zygarde moves.

name: Ice Stone
description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of\nPokémon evolve. It has an unmistakable\nsnowflake pattern.

name: Ride Pager
description: By entering certain numbers on this pager,\nyou can summon Ride Pokémon in an instant.

name: Beast Ball
description: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts.\nIt has a low success rate for catching others.

name: Big Malasada
description: The Alola region’s local specialty—fried bread.\nIt can be used once to heal all the status conditions\nof a Pokémon.

name: Red Nectar
description: A flower nectar obtained at Ula’ula Meadow.\nIt changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Yellow Nectar
description: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow.\nIt changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Pink Nectar
description: The flower nectar obtained at the flowering shrubs\non Royal Avenue.\nIt changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Purple Nectar
description: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow.\nIt changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Sun Flute
description: It is said that the tones it produces were offered\nup as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary\nPokémon of the sun.

name: Moon Flute
description: It is said that the tones it produces were offered\nup as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary\nPokémon of the moon.

name: Enigmatic Card
description: A mysterious card.\nWritten on it is a request for you to go to a\nguest room in an Akala motel on Route 8.

name: Terrain Extender
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the\nduration of the terrain caused by the holder’s move\nor Ability.

name: Protective Pads
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads\nprotect the holder from effects caused by\nmaking direct contact with the target.

name: Electric Seed
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense\non Electric Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Psychic Seed
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def\non Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Misty Seed
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def\non Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Grassy Seed
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense\non Grassy Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Fighting Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Fighting-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Flying Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Flying-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Poison Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Poison-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Ground Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Ground-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Rock Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Rock-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Bug Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Bug-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Ghost Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Ghost-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Steel Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Steel-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Fire Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Fire-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Water Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Water-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Grass Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Grass-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Electric Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Electric-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Psychic Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Psychic-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Ice Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Ice-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Dragon Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Dragon-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Dark Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Dark-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Fairy Memory
description: A memory disc that contains Fairy-type data.\nIt changes the type of the holder if held by\na certain species of Pokémon.

name: Solganium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Solgaleo’s Sunsteel Strike to a Z-Move.

name: Lunalium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Lunala’s Moongeist Beam to a Z-Move.

name: Ultranecrozium Z
description: This is a crystallized form of Z-Power.\nIt upgrades Necrozma’s Photon Geyser to\na Z-Move.

name: Mimikium Z
